reviewText: We love the Penguins of Madagascar in our household and quickly snap up any new DVDs that come up. I have to admit, however, operation Antarctica just did not grab me as previous DVD compilations (i.e. I was a penguin zombie!, New to the Zoo, Operation DVD). The characters were still funny, but I felt that the stories picked for the compilation were not as strong as in previous offerings. We've watched the other movies many times over, but Antarctica only once or twice.
summary: The penguins are still great! Just not as good as it used to be...

reviewText: I have every one of the films of the Penguins of Madagascar and watch them two or three times a  month.  They make me laugh.  The writers need to keep producing these stories since old and young alike are into them for fun.  The black and white boys know how to have a good time.  In this story, Hunter, the sea pup, is the main character with the penguin team coming to the rescue.  Buy the film and take the journey with the boys and Hunter and find out what happens in the end since seals like penguins for snacks.  As always,  a hoot with some great characters such as King Julien, the Lemur King XIII, who is a stowaway on the submarine and know it all Kowalski, one of the penguins.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think this movie was funny and entertaining. I felt the price was very reasonable for the amount of episodes that came on the disc. A must buy for your family!

reviewText: Nickelodeon doesn't seem to be broadcasting Penguins of Madagascar episodes any longer, and they're not available on Verizon Fios On-Demand, so I purchased all 8 available Penguins DVDs.  This one is excellent, and so are the other seven.  The total running time is 88 minutes, and the episodes include: Operation: Antarctica; The Falcon & The Snow Job; Penguiner Takes All; Roger Dodger; Snakehead!; Concrete Jungle Survival; and Work Order.
Title: N/A
